topic.title: 2.9 Malfunction / Accident Prevention Switches / Key Switches

header.para: Malfunction / Accident Prevention Switches / Key Switches

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

td.para: When the Emergency Stop switch is pressed, axis feed, Spindle rotation and all other machine functions stop immediately. Once this switch is pressed, it is locked in this position. The lock can be released by turning the switch in the direction indicated by the arrow.

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:5%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;
vertical-align:middle; width:65%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-bottom:none; border-left:none;

para.text: The machine goes to the following status when the Emergency Stop switch is pressed:

td.style: vertical-align:middle; width:65%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-bottom:none; border-left:none;

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: Feed of all axes is immediately stopped.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: Spindle is stopped if it is rotating.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: If unclamped, the Spindle Tool is clamped.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: When Spindle orientation has been performed, orientation status is released.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: When a Tool change is being performed, operation stops immediately (even in mid-motion).

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: When the Tool magazine is operating, it is stopped immediately (even in mid-motion).

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;
li.text: NC unit goes to Reset status.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:5px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:41px left ;

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:5%; height:15px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;
vertical-align:middle; width:65%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-bottom:none; border-left:none;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:5px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: For details on the restore procedure from the Emergency Stop status (
para.link: Refer to Chapter 5, 2.2 Recovery from Emergency Stop

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:5%; height:15px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;
vertical-align:middle; width:65%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-bottom:none; border-left:none;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Emergency Stop switches are also located on the following parts in addition to the main operation panel: (Refer to

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:5px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:5%; height:50px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:5px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The machine is in the Emergency Stop status and will not be started up until the lock is released by turning the switch in the direction indicated by the arrow and the

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Pressing this switch will deactivate any current Alarm that occurred during operation.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Alarm Reset can also be done on the screen.

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.text: [MODE UNLOCK] Key Switch (only for Door Lock / CE specifications)

When this key switch is turned to the right it is enabled, allowing the operation mode to be changed. After an operation mode is selected, turning this key switch to the left disables the mode. Remove the key to ensure operator safety.
When the Operator Door is open, the operation mode cannot be changed.
This switch turns Memory Protect Release mode ON/OFF. When the memory is unlocked, the following operations are enabled:

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;
li.text: Registration of NC program in memory from external device.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.text: This switch is used for the following purposes:

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;
li.text: hen the Emergency Stop status has been triggered by overtravel (OT2) of a feed axis, that axis is moved in the opposite direction back within its stroke while holding down this switch. The Emergency Stop status is released while this switch is pressed.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-19px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:22px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:15px left ;
li.text: When the machine stops during the Tool change or other operation and all the feed axes are in the Interlock status, use this switch to release the interlock and move the axes. The Interlock is released while this switch is pressed. Only the Handle mode and Jog mode are enabled at this time (Refer to

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: This switch is used to release the Interlock when performing maintenance operation.
